element.name: strip
element.short: Strips the dashes from a product key after verifying the product key length.

element.name: translatealpha
element.short: Translates a product key character to its base24 equivalent value.

element.name: Decode
element.short: Decodes a product key into its binary form

element.name: VerifyCrc
element.short: Verifies the built-in checksum for newer (Windows 8 and above) product keys.

element.name: crctable
element.short: Table for ISO/IEC 8802-3:1996 aka POSIX 1003.2 cksum

element.name: printcomposite
element.short: Prints the composite number for newer keys (starting with Windows 8), i.e.

element.name: Main
element.descr:
mpkdec decodes Microsoft product keys into their binary form and prints the decoded binary key as hexadecimal.
Keys used in newer versions of Windows starting with Windows 8, i.e. those containing an N anywhere in them, will also have their built-in checksum verified. An error is printed to stderr if the checksum mismatches.
The output for keys in the era of Windows Vista and 7 will be garbage. This is because the keys have additional obfuscation.
It will read and display the composite number for keys containing an N. This is not possible for older keys because the composite position varies wildly.
